intro: Boopis bupleuroides, commonly known as the bluebells, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its clusters of small, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of other members of the carrot family. Boopis bupleuroides is often found in moist woodlands and thrives in partial shade.
